meanings.definition: Excellent or fine in appearance or quality.
meanings.sent1: The cake looked braw with colorful frosting.
meanings.sent2: She wore a braw dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The braw sunset painted the sky in beautiful hues.
meanings.sent4: Her braw voice filled the room with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The braw garden was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: To fight or engage in physical combat.
meanings.sent1: The knights brawled fiercely in the tournament.
meanings.sent2: They brawled over the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully brawled over the TV remote.
meanings.sent4: The two teams brawled for victory on the field.
meanings.sent5: The wrestlers brawled in the ring with determination.

meanings.sent1: The braw between the two students caused a commotion.
meanings.sent2: The bar erupted into a loud braw.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon characters had a silly braw over a banana.
meanings.sent4: The braw in the movie was intense and realistic.
meanings.sent5: The braw in the playground was quickly broken up by the teacher.
